title: where can i go and camp right on the beach in the uk ??help

posts.content: as above, ive seen loads of pics where people have got there splitscreen busses right on the sand but i cant find any official places , can anyone help

Was at Cae Du in Wales a few weekends back - absolutely stunning views, and right next to the sea. More pebbles than sand to be fair but stunning place to camp none the less!

Can get reviews on it from http://www.coolcamping.co.uk/campsites/uk/wales/snowdonia/gwynedd/cae-du

Its a wee bit remote but take your own entertainment and its a great spot, the farmer drives round on a night selling bags of wood to burn - extremely rare these days!

Would highly recommend it!

P

Black rock sands, Porthmadog, North Wales
But I'd never take mine on the beach, salts a splits worst enemy

Polzeath in Cornwall - I quite often stay overnight or for up to a week or so outside of the August season, as long as you buy a parking ticket. And the public toilets across the road are open all year and all night.

Porth near Newquay has a beach you can drive onto and park too but I've not camped there yet.

Forgot to say, check the high water mark (where the seaweed gets to) and then make sure you're not due a spring tide. Don't want to wake up under water.

At Polzeath the surf school have a trailer on the beach. If that's not there you shouldn't be either!
